plot: The Top Gear team are in search of the ultimate family car and compare the best hatchbacks. Jason and Richard put on a diet a 1995 Jaguar XJS V12, as the chef, Gordon Ramsay, has to taste some unusually prepared gastronomic delights.

The team compare the Renault Espace, Volvo XC90 Estate, Subaru Forester 2.0 XT, Volkswagen Golf R32, Ford Focus RS, Honda Civic Type R and SEAT Leon Cupra R in their search for the ultimate family car. While driving a Radical SR3, The Stig meets his match in the form of a CAP 232 aerobatic plane. Gordon Ramsay is the Star In A Reasonably Priced Car, and he has to taste food that has been cooked on a car's motor.—Allister Coots

In search of the ultimate family car, the Top Gear team try out the futuristic, Renault Espace; the mid-size SUV, Volvo XC90; the compact, Subaru Forester, and the four-wheel drive, Toyota Land Cruiser. Next, the boys compare the best hot hatchbacks--the high-performance, Volkswagen Golf R32, Honda Civic Type R, SEAT Leon Cupra R, and Ford Focus RS--as Jason and Richard put on a diet a 1995 Jaguar XJS V12. Meanwhile, the Scottish chef, Gordon Ramsay, has to taste Top Gear's gastronomic delights--a succulent turkey breast with porcini mushrooms strapped to Subaru Forester's flat-four engine, and a mouth-watering rack of lamb prepared on the engine of a Lada Riva. In the end, the Stig warms up a Radical SR3, for a dogfight with the super-fast competition aerobatic plane, Mudry CAP-232.—Nick Riganas
